title: Make It Right (Lisa Stansfield song)
text:
"Make It Right" is a song recorded by the British singer, <a href="Lisa%20Stansfield">Lisa Stansfield</a>, for the 1994 to the American drama series, "<a href="Beverly%20Hills%2C%2090210">Beverly Hills, 90210</a>". It was written by <a href="Rhett%20Lawrence">Rhett Lawrence</a>, <a href="Crystal%20Bernard">Crystal Bernard</a> and Suzie Benson, and produced by Lawrence and Ian Devaney.
Release.
It was released as a promotional single in the United States on 5 September 1994. Therefore, it was not eligible to chart on the <a href="Billboard%20Hot%20100">"Billboard" Hot 100</a>. However, "Make It Right" reached number forty-six on the <a href="Hot%20Dance%20Club%20Songs">Hot Dance Club Songs</a> chart and sixty four on the <a href="Hot%20R%26amp%3BB/Hip-Hop%20Songs">Hot R&B Singles</a> chart. The CD single was released in Germany on 2 October 1994 but failed to chart because of lack of promotion and no music video. "Make It Right" was also issued as a mini CD single in Japan on 23 November 1994. The song was remixed by <a href="R.%20Kelly">R. Kelly</a>, <a href="Kenny%20%26quot%3BDope%26quot%3B%20Gonzalez">Kenny "Dope" Gonzalez</a> and Rhett Lawrence. "Make It Right" was not included on any of Stansfield's albums.
Critical reception.
<a href="Larry%20Flick">Larry Flick</a> from "<a href="Billboard%20%28magazine%29">Billboard</a>" described the song as a "Stansfield jam that is stronger than anything she has offered in a long while." He noted that she "excels amid a flurry of <a href="New%20Jack%20Swing">jack</a>/<a href="funk">funk</a> beats and whispery backing vocals. Her fluid vocal tones flow freely over a hummable melody." Dave Sholin from the "<a href="Gavin%20Report">Gavin Report</a>" commented, "School's almost in session, and it coincides with release of the sequel to the "Beverly Hills 90210" Soundtrack: Volume 2 The College Years. Lisa Stansfield is a brilliant choice to pair with this song. <a href="R.%20Kelly">R. Kelly</a>'s re-mix is the one for Top 40."
